availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Henderson County, Kentucky, farmer. Henderson County, Kentucky, native. Son of Lewis Ludwig Rouse and Elizabeth Garrett Rouse. Married to Jane Elizabeth McClanahan Rouse in Henderson County, Kentucky, on December 14, 1834. Father of James W. Rouse and Susan Alice Rouse. Married to Eliza Jane Nelson Rouse in Henderson County on April 3, 1852. Father of Mary Ella Rouse, Richard Rouse, William D. Rouse, and Berry Rouse. Farmer in Henderson County in 1850. Owned one enslaved person (listed as a fugitive) in Henderson County in 1850. Farmer in Henderson County in 1860. Employed Daniel McMullen, Thomas Swainey, Thomas Talbott, Arthur Talbott, George Guodquinn, Frank Painter, Nathaniel Painter, Joseph Painter, Charles Painter, and James Dugle as laborers in Henderson County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Henderson County in 1860.
